definition: prefix used before the surname of a person or a numeral indicating the order of birth of the children in a family or to indicate affection or familiarity/old (of people)/venerable (person)/experienced/of long standing/always/all the time/of the past/very/outdated/(of meat etc) tough

to fall/to drop/to lag behind/to lose/to go missing/to reduce/fall (in prices)/to lose (value, weight etc)/to wag/to swing/to turn/to change/to exchange/to swap/to show off/to shed (hair)/(used after certain verbs to express completion, fulfillment, removal etc)

sentences.english: Remember the previous pictures of the old and rotten vessel which is out-of-date?
sentences.chinese: 还记得前面那艘过时的老掉牙的生锈的船吗？

sentences.english: Let's get rid of this moldy old furniture.
sentences.chinese: 我们把这件老掉牙的旧家具抛弃吧。

sentences.english: Most pick-up lines are just stale closed-ended statements.
sentences.chinese: 大多数的搭讪语都是老掉牙的封闭的陈述。

sentences.english: To talk to him was like listening to the tinkling of a worn-out musical-box.
sentences.chinese: 跟他说话，犹如听一架老掉牙的八音盒子丁冬响。

sentences.english: When they are naggingly repeating some age-old stories.
sentences.chinese: 当他们罗罗嗦唆重复一些老掉牙的故事。

definition: to fall behind the ranks/to be outdated
lit. new wine in old bottles; fig. new concepts in an old framework/(loan idiom from Matthew 9:17, but fig. meaning is opposite)
to play the same old tune (idiom); unoriginal
old wine in a new bottle (idiom)
